summary: I have been involved in various projects connected to my experiences as a designer, researcher, and social psychologist in the past couple of years. Now I work at the Technological University of Eindhoven as a PhD candidate. My research is centered around the sustainability of science (or lack thereof). I currently conduct studies on the experiences and psychology of scientists.

treasury_media.title: Why some PhD students may decide to leave academia
treasury_media.description: TU/e researcher Andrea Kis discusses her research into the correlation between bad workplace experiences and the decisions PhD researchers make to abandon their PhD research.

treasury_media.title: Dicecal - Silver Award Winner Design
treasury_media.description:
My Silver Award Winner Design for the A'Design Awards & Competition in 2015.
The Dicecal is a 12-sided 3D calendar with an extra feature: you can also use it as multiple role-playing dice. The decorative and creative design comes very handy to everyone who, like most gamers, are often in need of various dice. Each side shows not only a month of the year with the days but also a result of a roll using a 2-3-4-6-12 sided die as well.

projects.title: Simply business
projects.description:
Simply business is my very first business card design project on Behance. When I decided on making business card templates, I had a clear image in mind: What I wanted was geometric, line-based and simple; it had to compliment the info of the clients and also look nice and fresh. 
 
So here's my interpretation of simply business..

profile_positions.title: PHD Candidate

profile_positions.description:
Participant in the Young Researcher Talent Program at Debrecen University. During my membership I focused on understanding several different research methods and topics. Such topics included:
- Voluntary Childlessness in Hungary
- Marketing Psychology - Measuring the Effectiveness of Anti-Smoking Ads Considering the Fears of Postadolescent Youth in Hungary
profile_positions.title: Research Intern

profile_positions.description:
Researching how reading is affected by digital environments and what effects these have on thought processes and reading habits. This line of research was conducted while I attended Debrecen University and gained my BA in Information Scineces.

Conferences attended (presentation title | conference | date):
•	Sociology of Reading and Library Pedagogy  in a Different Way | IT DAYS, Hungary | March 2010 
•	Changed Reading - Preparatory Studies | University of Debrecen, IT Department, Scientific Student Conference | May 2010
•	Changed Reading | Multimedia in Education | July 2010
•	Changed Reading in a Multimedial Environment | University of Debrecen, IT Department, Scientific Student Conference, 2. place | November 2010
•	 Changed Reading in a Multimedial Environment | XXX. National Scientific Student Conference | April 2011
•	Studies in Reading Methods and Results | University of Debrecen, IT Department, Scientific Student Conference, 1. place | December 2011
•	This is How Today's Youth Reads | Researchers' Night | September 2012
•	Differences in reading habits | Library 2.0 | October 2012
•	Lending eBooks in National Libraries | IT Days | October 2012
•	Map of Europe's Digital Literacy | IT Days | October 2012
•	Europe's Digital Literacy...  | University of Debrecen, IT Department, Scientific Student Conference, 2. place | November 2012
•	Digital Literacy of MIddle School Students within the EU | XXXI. National Scientific Student Conference | April 2013
•	Classic Harmony in the Digital Era... | 2nd See Science | March 2013
•	Digital literacy in Europe | Researchers' Night | September 2013
•	Formula of Digital Literacy... | University of Debrecen, IT Department, Scientific Student Conference, commendation | April 2014

profile_positions.title: Marketing Graphic Designer

profile_positions.description: As a Designer I worked with my clients on various designs (including, but not limited to webdesign, branding, painting, posters and ads, banners and Facebook covers...). I also worked on creating and implementing their marketing strategies and developing and writing content. Recently I had the opportunity to work on several projects related to science communication - I developed complex strategies (including research, building marketing personas and working on inbound strategies based on these) and created content ideas and articles.

volunteer_experiences.description:
The Society for the Improvement of Psychological Science (SIPS) brings together scholars working to improve methods and practices in psychological science. SIPS is a service organization aiming to make psychological science higher quality and more cumulative.
https://improvingpsych.org/

company.name: Framework for Open and Reproducible Research Training (FORRT)

volunteer_experiences.description: Team ND co-lead at Framework for Open and Reproducible Research Training (FORRT)
I co-founded and helped set up the website https://ukrainehelp.hu/

Planning for conference trips? Make it greener!
With this slogan, we, a group of academics concerned about our carbon footprint, kicked off our Low Carbon Travel Initiative at the Eindhoven University of Technology (TU/e). This is a first step in making TU/e work travel more sustainable.
http://lowcarboninitiative.nl/

Bike Maffia is one of the most fastly developing Hungarian non-profit organizations. It was established on Christmas Eve 2011 by a group of young bikers. Their goal was selfless assistance - to help those who are in need in collaboration with already proven professional organizations. They decided to focus on promoting empathic and selfless behavior in order to make our world livable.

The main target group of DBM is homeless people, poor families of all sizes, institutions or shelters with minimum support but with important work. In addition to these activities, volunteers participating in DBM's work find it important to change the way of thinking of adolescents and youngsters and increase their social awareness.

The City is For All is a volunteer based grassroots organization operating in Budapest (Hungary), in which homeless (currently or past) and non-homeless activists work together for housing rights and social justice.

The organization operates as an informal advocacy group. It is an independent group that depends on the volunteer work contribution and financial support of its members. The group represents a wide range of people living in poverty and/or homelessness. The group’s goal is to empower homeless people to stand up for their human dignity and to fight for right to housing. Homeless people play a leading role in all aspects of the group.
